name: Sheet Pan Ratatouille with Polenta
description: This bright and colorful Sheet Pan Ratatouille is a modern twist on the classic French chunky summer vegetable stew, rich with olive oil and fragrant with plenty of herbs. Serve over creamy polenta for the perfect summer dinner.
recipeIngredient: 1  red bell pepper (chopped into 3/4 inch slices)
1 tsp dried basil (or 2 tbsp fresh basil)
15 oz can of tomatoes (or 3 tomatoes, chopped)

recipeInstructions.text: Chop all the vegetables and add to a baking dish. Use a baking dish that is large enough that all the vegetables are in a single layer.
recipeInstructions.name: Chop all the vegetables and add to a baking dish. Use a baking dish that is large enough that all the vegetables are in a single layer.

recipeInstructions.text: Drizzle the oil all over over, then mix in. Add in the herbs, salt, and pepper, and mix in, and spread again.
recipeInstructions.name: Drizzle the oil all over over, then mix in. Add in the herbs, salt, and pepper, and mix in, and spread again.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 400 degrees F ( 205 c) for 30 to 35 minutes, or until the eggplant is almost done.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 400 degrees F ( 205 c) for 30 to 35 minutes, or until the eggplant is almost done.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in your tomatoes, and mix in, and bake for another 10-15 minutes so that the tomatoes start to get tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in your tomatoes, and mix in, and bake for another 10-15 minutes so that the tomatoes start to get tender.

recipeInstructions.text: In the meanwhile, make your polenta by heating up the water until hot, then add in the polenta gradually while whisking. Add in salt nutritional yeast, vegan butter, and mix in. Continue to cook until the polenta is cooked to preference.
recipeInstructions.name: In the meanwhile, make your polenta by heating up the water until hot, then add in the polenta gradually while whisking. Add in salt nutritional yeast, vegan butter, and mix in. Continue to cook until the polenta is cooked to preference.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the baking dish from the oven, and then taste and adjust flavor.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the baking dish from the oven, and then taste and adjust flavor.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the baked ratatouille over the polenta in bowls. Sprinkle some pepper flakes, fresh basil, or parsley.
